articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: French doctor: Virus from China seems less serious than SARS
articles.description: The lead doctor for two Paris hospital patients being treated for the new virus behind a health crisis in China says the chance of a European epidemic appears weak at this stage
articles.content: Still, France remained concerned about its citizens in Wuhan, the now-locked down Chinese city where the outbreak began. Frances Foreign Ministry said Saturday that French and Chinese officials were studying eventual options that would allow our nationals who… [+2501 chars]

articles.title: Maps show where coronavirus started and why officials are so worried
articles.description: Since late December, more than 800 cases of coronavirus have been confirmed.
articles.content:
This is the market where officials say the coronavirus first jumped from animal to person. Known for selling exotic wildlife, the market is in the heart of Wuhan, a city of nearly 11 million people in the Hubei province.

articles.description: The lead doctor for two Paris hospital patients being treated for the new virus behind a health crisis in China says the chance of a European epidemic appears weak at this stage
articles.content: Dr. Yazdan Yazdanpaneh said the two patients at Paris Bichat-Claude Bernard Hospital have separate, specially equipped rooms and were doing well. He could not say when they may eventually be released. Ways in which the virus can be transmitted remain unclear.… [+1768 chars]

articles.author: Simon Denyer
articles.title: Coronavirus outbreak underscores potential health risks in China's wild animal trade
articles.description: Health experts say China failed to heed lessons from the SARS epidemic.
articles.content:
China implemented controls on wildlife markets after SARS epidemic, but those controls soon evaporated. The country remains a major consumer of wild and endangered animals for meat, as well as in traditional medicine.
Yuen Kwok-yung at the University of Hong… [+4212 chars]

articles.description: China has expanded travel lockdowns and granted local governments emergency powers, but experts say this may not be enough to prevent the disease spreading further.

articles.title: New virus mutes Lunar New Year mood in Asia
articles.description: A new virus that started in China is hanging over the first day of the Year of the Rat in much of Asia
articles.content:
The new coronavirus from a family of viruses that also caused the deadly SARS epidemic in 2002-03 didnt stop everyone from going to temples, but many wore face masks as protection.
